betterquesting:10.name:8: A Beginner's Guide to Particle Physics
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
If you've built the Source Chamber already, you may have noticed that particles aren't produced as items, like GT++ ones are. 

Instead they're transmitted through Beamline Pipes from multi to multi, similar to real life.

Each stream of particles transmitted, or "beam", has four properties:
- §
§
§6Particle§r: the type of particle carried by the beam
- §4Energy§r: the amount of energy the particles have
§r- §9Focus§r: out of 100, how focused the beam is
§r- §dAmount§r: a measure of the number of particles in the beam

Note that you can see info about a multi's input and output beams by using a Tricorder on the controller.

For the recipes you'll be interested in, i.e. the ones that actually produce items, there'll be a threshold for allowed input beam energy, a minimum focus value, and an amount value which determines recipe time (more on that in the Target Chamber quest). 
Take a look some TC recipes for an example of this.


Have a photon. To hang on your wall.
